latest.title: Admission to Trading
latest.content:
19 Dec 2025 08:09
RNS Number : 2127M
Satsuma Technology PLC
19 December 2025
19 December 2025
Satsuma Technology PLC
('Satsuma' or the 'Company')
Admission to the Equity Shares (Commercial Companies) category
Satsuma Technology PLC (the "Company" or "Satsuma") is pleased to announce that, the Company's ordinary shares of £0.001 each (the "Ordinary Shares") have been admitted to the Equity Shares (Commercial Companies) category of the Official List of the FCA and to trading on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange.
Admission became effective at 8.00 a.m. (GMT) today, 19 December 2025
Following Admission, the Company's Ordinary Shares remain registered under the existing ISIN GB00BMFCRZ80 and the TIDM remains SATS.
Satsuma Technology PLC
Henry K. Elder, CEO
Data Counsel
Steffan Williams
William Barker

latest.title: Director/PDMR Shareholding
latest.content:
19 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 2125M
Satsuma Technology PLC
19 December 2025
19 December 2025
Satsuma Technology PLC
('Satsuma' or the 'Company')
Notification and public disclosure of transactions by persons discharging managerial responsibilities ("PDMR")
Satsuma Technology PLC (LSE: SATS) announces that the Company has granted options to each of Henry Elder and Andrew Smith, in accordance with the terms of the Satsuma Technology PLC (Employees) Share Option Plan, to subscribe for 560,195,010 Ordinary Shares and 168,058,503 new Ordinary Shares respectively, vesting equally over 4 years, at an exercise price of (i) £0.01 per Ordinary Share for those options vesting on the first and second anniversary from the date of the grant, and (ii) £0.02 per Ordinary Share for those options vesting on the third and fourth anniversary from the date of the grant.
In addition, further to the conversion of the loan notes as announced on 17 December 2025, the Company has allotted and issued 50,000,000 Ordinary Shares to Henry Elder on 18 December 2025.

latest.title: Publication of Prospectus
latest.content:
17 Dec 2025 12:37
RNS Number : 9812L
Satsuma Technology PLC
17 December 2025
This announcement is an advertisement for the purposes of the Prospectus Regulation Rules of the Financial Conduct Authority and not a prospectus. This announcement does not constitute or form part of, and should not be construed as, an offer for sale or subscription of, or solicitation of any offer to subscribe for or to acquire, any ordinary shares of Satsuma Technologies plc in any jurisdiction, including in or into or from the United States of America, Australia, Canada, Japan, the Republic of South Africa or in any other jurisdiction.
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
17 December 2025
Satsuma Technology PLC
('Satsuma' or the 'Company')
Publication of Prospectus, issue of Ordinary Shares and proposed Admission
Satsuma Technology PLC (LSE: SATS) is pleased to announce that a prospectus (the "Prospectus") in relation to the proposed admission of its ordinary shares of £0.001 each ("Ordinary Shares") to the Equity Shares (Commercial Companies) Category of the Official List of the Financial Conduct Authority (the "FCA") and to trading on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange (together, "Admission") has been approved by the FCA and published by the Company today.
Strategic transition
As detailed in the Company's strategy within the Prospectus, the Company intends to develop Bitcoin-based revenue lines, including Bitcoin staking and decentralised AI operations, to generate accretive cash flow that supports the continued accumulation of Bitcoin in the Company's treasury. T
his operational strategy will be implemented organically and through acquisitions. It
is designed to complement the Company's treasury policy of holding Bitcoin as its primary reserve asset.
Issue of new Ordinary Shares and Financial Position
Following the approval of the Prospectus, £90,761,000 in nominal value of convertible loan notes (CLN 1 and CLN 2) will automatically convert in accordance with their terms. Consequently, on 18 December 2025, the Company will allot and issue 10,676,100,000 new Ordinary Shares ("New Shares"). The total issued share capital immediately following Admission will be 11,203,900,200 Ordinary Shares.
As announced on 11 December 2025, the Company holds approximately £90.0 million in cash. The Company intends to utilise this cash balance to repay approximately £78.2 million to remaining noteholders upon the maturity of the outstanding loan notes on 30 December 2025.
Following this repayment, the Company expects to retain approximately £11.8 million in cash and hold 620 Bitcoin (worth £40.5 million based on the current market
price of Bitcoin
) with no material liabilities. The asset base of the Company will therefore be approximately £52.3 million.
Admission
Admission is expected to take place at 8.00 a.m. on 19 Decemb
er 2025 but may occur on any business day up to and including 31 December 2025.
Under Listing Rule 3.2.7R, the Company is required to have an expected market capitalisation of at least £30.0 million prior to Admission
. As set out above, following
the scheduled repayment of loan notes, the Company's asset base, comprising 620 Bitcoin worth £40.5 million and
approximately £11
.8 million cash, will be approximately £52.3 million. Consequently, the Board expects the Company's market capitalisation on Admission to significantly exceed the regulatory minimum.
Satsuma is not offering any new Ordinary Shares nor any other securities in connection with the proposed Admission. Following Admission, the Ordinary Shares will continue to be registered with their existing ISIN of GB00BMFCRZ80 and the TIDM will remain SATS.
The Prospectus has been approved by the FCA and will shortly be available to view on Satsuma's website,
https://www.satsuma.digital/investors
. A copy of the Prospectus will be submitted to the National Storage Mechanism and will be available for inspection at
https://data.fca.org.uk/#/nsm/nationalstoragemechanism
.
Total Voting Rights
For the purposes of the DTRs, the total number of Ordinary Shares in issue following the allotment and issue of the New Shares will be 11,203,900,200 with each Ordinary Share carrying the right to one vote. There are no Ordinary Shares held in treasury and therefore the total number of voting rights in the Company following the allotment and issue of the New Shares will be 11,203,900,200. The above figure may be used by shareholders in the Company as the denominator for the calculations by which they will determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or a change to their interest in, the share capital of the Company under the DTRs.
Capitalised terms used in the Prospectus have the same meanings in this announcement.
Henry K. Elder, CEO, commented:
"The publication of the Prospectus represents a definitive milestone in Satsuma's evolution
. As a result, we will enter the new year with a strategy underpinned by a liquid debt-free balance sheet, securities listed on the UK Main Market, and a high-calibre leadership team.
"With these foundations in place, our singular focus shifts to execution and driving long-term shareholder value.
"
Satsuma Technology PLC
Henry K. Elder, CEO
Data Counsel
Steffan Williams
William Barker
+44 (0)20 3855 8888
satsuma@datacounsel.uk
+44 (0)7767 345 563
+44 (0)7534 068 657

company_30s.what_they_do: SATS Ltd. is a small UK‑listed company that has recently changed its name and board composition, but it has no publicly disclosed product or revenue stream.
company_30s.why_they_matter: The company is a potential micro‑cap play for traders looking for a cheap, high‑risk speculative bet, though its lack of fundamentals means it is essentially a lottery ticket.
company_30s.current_state: SATS is trading at zero price, has no volatility, and is effectively a shell with no clear business model or earnings.

rns_narrative: Board reshuffle: A flurry of board appointments and a name change in July 2025 suggest an attempt to reset governance and attract fresh capital.
Bitcoin strategy: The appointment of a Bitcoin Treasury Strategist and a CEO purchase of Bitcoin indicate a pivot toward crypto‑related activities, but no accompanying revenue plan.
Convertible notes: The closing of a second convertible loan note and the exercise of warrants point to a fundraising cycle, yet the company has not yet posted any income or cash flow.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community is essentially silent—no posts, no sentiment data—so there is no real consensus, only a lack of interest.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: A few speculative traders whisper that the Bitcoin move could unlock value if the company can monetize crypto holdings.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Most observers view the repeated board changes as a red flag, signalling instability and a lack of a coherent strategy.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: There was no measurable sentiment two weeks ago, and still none today; the story has never built traction.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows zero search volume and flat momentum, confirming that the market has not paid any attention to SATS. The absence of social media chatter and zero trend interest mean the story is essentially dead oxygen.

near_term_catalysts: Q3 2025 AGM (Sep): Potential shareholder vote on a new business plan or a further dilution event. Any decision could move the price in a short window.
Bitcoin holdings audit (Oct): If the company releases a credible audit showing significant crypto assets, it could spark a brief rally among crypto‑centric traders.
expect_next.watch_for: Monitor for any earnings release or cash‑flow statement—none have been filed in the last 12 months. Watch for insider selling or a sudden spike in the number of new shares issued, which would confirm a dilution event.
expect_next.timing_regime: Exhausted. The APEX chart quality score is low, volatility is zero, and the stock has already fallen 98.6% from its peak. There is no room for a meaningful entry window.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: A bullish scenario would require the company to disclose a profitable crypto‑related business, a credible revenue stream, and a clear path to profitability. Only then could the price recover from zero.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: Given the lack of any operational data, zero volatility, and no recent market interest, the stock is likely to remain at or near zero. The risk of a permanent write‑down is very high.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk/reward is poor—there is virtually no upside potential because the price cannot rise from zero without a fundamental breakthrough.

playbook.if_bullish: Do not take a position. The company lacks any realistic upside and the risk of a permanent loss is 100%.
playbook.if_watching: If you must keep an eye on the ticker, stay out until a clear revenue announcement or a significant crypto asset valuation is released. Even then, the entry price will be negligible.
playbook.if_passing: Pass. The story is dead, the price is zero, and there are no catalysts to revive the stock. Allocate capital to higher‑quality micro‑cap opportunities.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass—SATS has no fundamentals, no market interest, and no realistic catalyst. The stock is effectively a zero‑price shell; there is no value to capture.
